benchmark_details.name: CogBench
benchmark_details.overview: CogBench is the first benchmark designed to evaluate the cross-lingual and cross-site generalizability of large language models (LLMs) for speech-based cognitive impairment assessment using a multimodal pipeline across English and Mandarin datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized evaluation framework for assessing the effectiveness of AI models in cognitive impairment classification using speech input.

data.source: CIR-E, ADReSSo, NCMMSC2021 datasets for evaluating cognitive impairment assessment.
data.annotation: Data was collected from naturalistic community settings and evaluated by neurologists.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions against the ground truth labels from cognitive assessments.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and macro-F1 scores indicate better performance of models in classifying cognitive impairment.
methodology.validation: Comprehensive evaluation across multiple datasets with varying difficulty levels.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from participants for data collection.
